4214 @_docstring.dedent_interpd
4215 def set_connectionstyle(self, connectionstyle=None, **kwargs):
4216 """
4217 Set the connection style, possibly with further attributes.
4218  
4219 Attributes from the previous connection style are not reused.
4220  
4221 Without argument (or with ``connectionstyle=None``), the available box
4222 styles are returned as a human-readable string.
4223  
4224 Parameters
4225 ----------
4226 connectionstyle : str or `~matplotlib.patches.ConnectionStyle`
4227 The style of the connection: either a `.ConnectionStyle` instance,
4228 or a string, which is the style name and optionally comma separated
4229 attributes (e.g. "Arc,armA=30,rad=10"). Such a string is used to
4230 construct a `.ConnectionStyle` object, as documented in that class.
4231  
4232 The following connection styles are available:
4233  
4234 %(ConnectionStyle:table_and_accepts)s
4235  
4236 **kwargs
4237 Additional attributes for the connection style. See the table above
4238 for supported parameters.
4239  
4240 Examples
4241 --------
4242 ::
4243  
4244 set_connectionstyle("Arc,armA=30,rad=10")
4245 set_connectionstyle("arc", armA=30, rad=10)
4246 """
4247 if connectionstyle is None:
4248 return ConnectionStyle.pprint_styles()
4249 self._connector = (
4250 ConnectionStyle(connectionstyle, **kwargs)
4251 if isinstance(connectionstyle, str) else connectionstyle)
4252 self.stale = True
4253  
4254 def get_connectionstyle(self):
4255 """Return the `ConnectionStyle` used."""
4256 return self._connector
4257  
4258 def set_arrowstyle(self, arrowstyle=None, **kwargs):
4259 """
4260 Set the arrow style, possibly with further attributes.
4261

4263  
4264 Without argument (or with ``arrowstyle=None``), the available box
4265 styles are returned as a human-readable string.
4266  
4267 Parameters
4268 ----------
4269 arrowstyle : str or `~matplotlib.patches.ArrowStyle`
4270 The style of the arrow: either a `.ArrowStyle` instance, or a
4271 string, which is the style name and optionally comma separated
4272 attributes (e.g. "Fancy,head_length=0.2"). Such a string is used to
4273 construct a `.ArrowStyle` object, as documented in that class.
4274  
4275 The following arrow styles are available:
4276  
4277 %(ArrowStyle:table_and_accepts)s
4278  
4279 **kwargs
4280 Additional attributes for the arrow style. See the table above for
4281 supported parameters.
4282  
4283 Examples
4284 --------
4285 ::
4286  
4287 set_arrowstyle("Fancy,head_length=0.2")
4288 set_arrowstyle("fancy", head_length=0.2)
4289 """
4290 if arrowstyle is None:
4291 return ArrowStyle.pprint_styles()
4292 self._arrow_transmuter = (
4293 ArrowStyle(arrowstyle, **kwargs)
4294 if isinstance(arrowstyle, str) else arrowstyle)
4295 self.stale = True
4296

4299 return self._arrow_transmuter

4337  
4338 def get_path(self):
4339 """Return the path of the arrow in the data coordinates."""
4340 # The path is generated in display coordinates, then converted back to
4341 # data coordinates.
4342 _path, fillable = self._get_path_in_displaycoord()
4343 if np.iterable(fillable):
4344 _path = Path.make_compound_path(*_path)
4345 return self.get_transform().inverted().transform_path(_path)
4346  
4347 def _get_path_in_displaycoord(self):
4348 """Return the mutated path of the arrow in display coordinates."""
4349 dpi_cor = self._dpi_cor
4350  
4351 if self._posA_posB is not None:
4352 posA = self._convert_xy_units(self._posA_posB[0])
4353 posB = self._convert_xy_units(self._posA_posB[1])
4354 (posA, posB) = self.get_transform().transform((posA, posB))
4355 _path = self.get_connectionstyle()(posA, posB,
4356 patchA=self.patchA,
4357 patchB=self.patchB,
4358 shrinkA=self.shrinkA * dpi_cor,
4359 shrinkB=self.shrinkB * dpi_cor
4360 )
4361 else:
4362 _path = self.get_transform().transform_path(self._path_original)
4363  
4364 _path, fillable = self.get_arrowstyle()(
4365 _path,
4366 self.get_mutation_scale() * dpi_cor,
4367 self.get_linewidth() * dpi_cor,
4368 self.get_mutation_aspect())
4369  
4370 return _path, fillable
4371  
4372 def draw(self, renderer):
4373 if not self.get_visible():
4374 return
4375  
4376 # FIXME: dpi_cor is for the dpi-dependency of the linewidth. There
4377 # could be room for improvement. Maybe _get_path_in_displaycoord could
4378 # take a renderer argument, but get_path should be adapted too.
4379 self._dpi_cor = renderer.points_to_pixels(1.)
4380 path, fillable = self._get_path_in_displaycoord()
4381  
4382 if not np.iterable(fillable):
4383 path = [path]
4384 fillable = [fillable]
4385  
4386 affine = transforms.IdentityTransform()
4387  
4388 self._draw_paths_with_artist_properties(
4389 renderer,
4390 [(p, affine, self._facecolor if f and self._facecolor[3] else None)
4391 for p, f in zip(path, fillable)])
4392  
4393  
4394 class ConnectionPatch(FancyArrowPatch):
4395 """A patch that connects two points (possibly in different axes)."""
4396  
4397 def __str__(self):
4398 return "ConnectionPatch((%g, %g), (%g, %g))" % \
4399 (self.xy1[0], self.xy1[1], self.xy2[0], self.xy2[1])
4400  
4401 @_docstring.dedent_interpd
4402 def __init__(self, xyA, xyB, coordsA, coordsB=None, *,
4403 axesA=None, axesB=None,
4404 arrowstyle="-",
4405 connectionstyle="arc3",
4406 patchA=None,
4407 patchB=None,
4408 shrinkA=0.,
4409 shrinkB=0.,
4410 mutation_scale=10.,
4411 mutation_aspect=None,
4412 clip_on=False,
4413 **kwargs):
4414 """
4415 Connect point *xyA* in *coordsA* with point *xyB* in *coordsB*.
4416  
4417 Valid keys are
4418  
4419 =============== ======================================================
4420 Key Description
4421 =============== ======================================================
4422 arrowstyle the arrow style
4423 connectionstyle the connection style
4424 relpos default is (0.5, 0.5)
4425 patchA default is bounding box of the text
4426 patchB default is None
4427 shrinkA default is 2 points
4428 shrinkB default is 2 points
4429 mutation_scale default is text size (in points)
4430 mutation_aspect default is 1.
4431 ? any key for `matplotlib.patches.PathPatch`
4432 =============== ======================================================
4433  
4434 *coordsA* and *coordsB* are strings that indicate the
4435 coordinates of *xyA* and *xyB*.
4436  
4437 ==================== ==================================================
4438 Property Description
4439 ==================== ==================================================
4440 'figure points' points from the lower left corner of the figure
4441 'figure pixels' pixels from the lower left corner of the figure
4442 'figure fraction' 0, 0 is lower left of figure and 1, 1 is upper
4443 right
4444 'subfigure points' points from the lower left corner of the subfigure
4445 'subfigure pixels' pixels from the lower left corner of the subfigure
4446 'subfigure fraction' fraction of the subfigure, 0, 0 is lower left.
4447 'axes points' points from lower left corner of axes
4448 'axes pixels' pixels from lower left corner of axes
4449 'axes fraction' 0, 0 is lower left of axes and 1, 1 is upper right
4450 'data' use the coordinate system of the object being
4451 annotated (default)
4452 'offset points' offset (in points) from the *xy* value
4453 'polar' you can specify *theta*, *r* for the annotation,
4454 even in cartesian plots. Note that if you are
4455 using a polar axes, you do not need to specify
4456 polar for the coordinate system since that is the
4457 native "data" coordinate system.
4458 ==================== ==================================================
4459  
4460 Alternatively they can be set to any valid
4461 `~matplotlib.transforms.Transform`.
4462  
4463 Note that 'subfigure pixels' and 'figure pixels' are the same
4464 for the parent figure, so users who want code that is usable in
4465 a subfigure can use 'subfigure pixels'.
4466  
4467 .. note::
4468  
4469 Using `ConnectionPatch` across two `~.axes.Axes` instances
4470 is not directly compatible with :ref:`constrained layout
4471 <constrainedlayout_guide>`. Add the artist
4472 directly to the `.Figure` instead of adding it to a specific Axes,
4473 or exclude it from the layout using ``con.set_in_layout(False)``.
4474  
4475 .. code-block:: default
4476  
4477 fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, constrained_layout=True)
4478 con = ConnectionPatch(..., axesA=ax[0], axesB=ax[1])
4479 fig.add_artist(con)
4480  
4481 """
4482 if coordsB is None:
4483 coordsB = coordsA
4484 # we'll draw ourself after the artist we annotate by default
4485 self.xy1 = xyA
4486 self.xy2 = xyB
4487 self.coords1 = coordsA
4488 self.coords2 = coordsB
4489  
4490 self.axesA = axesA
4491 self.axesB = axesB
4492  
4493 super().__init__(posA=(0, 0), posB=(1, 1),
4494 arrowstyle=arrowstyle,
4495 connectionstyle=connectionstyle,
4496 patchA=patchA, patchB=patchB,
4497 shrinkA=shrinkA, shrinkB=shrinkB,
4498 mutation_scale=mutation_scale,
4499 mutation_aspect=mutation_aspect,
4500 clip_on=clip_on,
4501 **kwargs)
4502 # if True, draw annotation only if self.xy is inside the axes
4503 self._annotation_clip = None
4504  
4505 def _get_xy(self, xy, s, axes=None):
4506 """Calculate the pixel position of given point."""
4507 s0 = s # For the error message, if needed.
4508 if axes is None:
4509 axes = self.axes
4510 xy = np.array(xy)
4511 if s in ["figure points", "axes points"]:
4512 xy *= self.figure.dpi / 72
4513 s = s.replace("points", "pixels")
4514 elif s == "figure fraction":
4515 s = self.figure.transFigure
4516 elif s == "subfigure fraction":
4517 s = self.figure.transSubfigure
4518 elif s == "axes fraction":
4519 s = axes.transAxes
4520 x, y = xy
4521  
4522 if s == 'data':
4523 trans = axes.transData
4524 x = float(self.convert_xunits(x))
4525 y = float(self.convert_yunits(y))
4526 return trans.transform((x, y))
4527 elif s == 'offset points':
4528 if self.xycoords == 'offset points': # prevent recursion
4529 return self._get_xy(self.xy, 'data')
4530 return (
4531 self._get_xy(self.xy, self.xycoords) # converted data point
4532 + xy * self.figure.dpi / 72) # converted offset
4533 elif s == 'polar':
4534 theta, r = x, y
4535 x = r * np.cos(theta)
4536 y = r * np.sin(theta)
4537 trans = axes.transData
4538 return trans.transform((x, y))
4539 elif s == 'figure pixels':
4540 # pixels from the lower left corner of the figure
4541 bb = self.figure.figbbox
4542 x = bb.x0 + x if x >= 0 else bb.x1 + x
4543 y = bb.y0 + y if y >= 0 else bb.y1 + y
4544 return x, y
4545 elif s == 'subfigure pixels':
4546 # pixels from the lower left corner of the figure
4547 bb = self.figure.bbox
4548 x = bb.x0 + x if x >= 0 else bb.x1 + x
4549 y = bb.y0 + y if y >= 0 else bb.y1 + y
4550 return x, y
4551 elif s == 'axes pixels':
4552 # pixels from the lower left corner of the axes
4553 bb = axes.bbox
4554 x = bb.x0 + x if x >= 0 else bb.x1 + x
4555 y = bb.y0 + y if y >= 0 else bb.y1 + y
4556 return x, y
4557 elif isinstance(s, transforms.Transform):
4558 return s.transform(xy)
4559 else:
4560 raise ValueError(f"{s0} is not a valid coordinate transformation")
4561  
4562 def set_annotation_clip(self, b):
4563 """
4564 Set the annotation's clipping behavior.
4565  
4566 Parameters
4567 ----------
4568 b : bool or None
4569 - True: The annotation will be clipped when ``self.xy`` is
4570 outside the axes.
4571 - False: The annotation will always be drawn.
4572 - None: The annotation will be clipped when ``self.xy`` is
4573 outside the axes and ``self.xycoords == "data"``.
4574 """
4575 self._annotation_clip = b
4576 self.stale = True
4577  
4578 def get_annotation_clip(self):
4579 """
4580 Return the clipping behavior.
4581  
4582 See `.set_annotation_clip` for the meaning of the return value.
4583 """
4584 return self._annotation_clip
4585  
4586 def _get_path_in_displaycoord(self):
4587 """Return the mutated path of the arrow in display coordinates."""
4588 dpi_cor = self._dpi_cor
4589 posA = self._get_xy(self.xy1, self.coords1, self.axesA)
4590 posB = self._get_xy(self.xy2, self.coords2, self.axesB)
4591 path = self.get_connectionstyle()(
4592 posA, posB,
4593 patchA=self.patchA, patchB=self.patchB,
4594 shrinkA=self.shrinkA * dpi_cor, shrinkB=self.shrinkB * dpi_cor,
4595 )
4596 path, fillable = self.get_arrowstyle()(
4597 path,
4598 self.get_mutation_scale() * dpi_cor,
4599 self.get_linewidth() * dpi_cor,
4600 self.get_mutation_aspect()
4601 )
4602 return path, fillable
4603  
4604 def _check_xy(self, renderer):
4605 """Check whether the annotation needs to be drawn."""
4606  
4607 b = self.get_annotation_clip()
4608  
4609 if b or (b is None and self.coords1 == "data"):
4610 xy_pixel = self._get_xy(self.xy1, self.coords1, self.axesA)
4611 if self.axesA is None:
4612 axes = self.axes
4613 else:
4614 axes = self.axesA
4615 if not axes.contains_point(xy_pixel):
4616 return False
4617  
4618 if b or (b is None and self.coords2 == "data"):
4619 xy_pixel = self._get_xy(self.xy2, self.coords2, self.axesB)
4620 if self.axesB is None:
4621 axes = self.axes
4622 else:
4623 axes = self.axesB
4624 if not axes.contains_point(xy_pixel):
4625 return False
4626  
4627 return True
4628  
4629 def draw(self, renderer):
4630 if renderer is not None:
4631 self._renderer = renderer
4632 if not self.get_visible() or not self._check_xy(renderer):
4633 return
4634 super().draw(renderer)
